narrative:
A hearty smell permeates the forest: a mix of fresh moss and old-growth trees. As you descend towards a streambank, your footfalls become more pronounced, and upon inspection you find that the carpet of greenery underfoot has been intentionally placed across a bed of crunchy dried leaves. Is this some kind of natural alarm system? You draw your weapons and prepare for a fight.

Before you have a chance to ponder it further, you spot a haggard woman on the path before you. She is inscrutably old and eyes you with a mix of curiosity and concern. A rope necklace entwined with tree bark hangs low across her torso.

The ground beneath you crinkles like autumn leaves and vines begin to root you in place.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Cut yourself free of the vines.

outcomes.narrative: With some deft action, you're able to break free of the root-like vines wrapping around your feet. Exhausted, you turn to face the woman, but she's already gone.

You hack at the vines underfoot, but for each one you cut, two more seem to sprout. They wrap their way around your boots and snake up your legs, pulling you towards the ground. The woman is long gone by the time you wriggle out.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Attack the woman.

outcomes.narrative: You attempt to dive towards the woman, but the root-like vines have wrapped your legs and are actively pulling you into the earth. The woman turns to leave as you are drawn down to your neck in the moss-covered ground. It takes hours of wriggling to free yourself.

options.label: C
options.narrative: Drop your weapons.

outcomes.narrative: You drop your weapons as a sign of respect, and the old woman silently recalls the roots into the earth. With a subtle shrug, she invites you to share a meal of root vegetables, wordlessly enjoying the company. Before you leave, she rubs each of your weapons with a purple vegetable, then wanders off into the forest. Strange.
effects: During the first round of the next scenario, each character adds %game.condition.poison% to all of their attacks performed.

narrative:
The morning tranquility is suddenly disturbed by a green-clad familiar face tumbling out of the underbrush. Your old friend the Silent Knife dusts themselves off, panting as they scan the horizon. They cast a furtive look over their shoulder before they finally spot you.

"Is that? It is!" You're not sure if it's relief or the formulation of a plan playing across their face. "Perfect timing, as always. Here, take this."

Gain "Major Element Potion" 045.

"Hang onto that, I'll come back for it." And with that, they take off at a dead sprint towards Gloomhaven.

A moment later, a guard steps out of the underbrush.

"You there! Did you see an assassin pass by here? They murdered an alchemist and made off with their potions!" You reflexively push the potion deeper into your satchel, although he narrows his eyes nearly imperceptibly.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Turn over the potion and point him in the direction of the Silent Knife.

outcomes.narrative: You hand off the potion and point out which way the Silent Knife ran. The guard thanks you for your help and rushes off in hot pursuit.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Try to throw him off the Silent Knife's trail.

outcomes.narrative: You spin a long-winded yarn about how a brigand held you at dagger-point, threatening your life, then ran off to the right. You watch the guard sprint off, knowing full well your friend went left.

Under pressure, you point in the first wrong direction you can think of: the way he just came from. "Empty your bags!" he orders. He confiscates the potion and writes you a written notice of a court date.

options.label: C
options.narrative: It's just like the Silent Knife to leave you to clean up their mess. Kill the guard.

outcomes.narrative: Two quick blows is all it takes, then it's a simple matter to dispose of them in a spot they won't be found. The Silent Knife owes you one.

narrative:
After an early start out the city gates this morning, you're still clustered with a group of early riser travelers. Each of you is trying to give some separation, but you're awkwardly all traveling the same direction, so it may be hours before you stop staring at the back of their heads.

The problem quickly solves itself, though: riding up on horses, a band of rough men overtake and surround your group. They look grim and dangerous, and you immediately pull out your weapons as they approach. As the encounter is about to come to blows, you hear a familiar laugh—it's the Silent Knife, riding with these miscreants.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Call out to the Silent Knife.

outcomes.condition: Trait Friend of The Silent Knife is present
outcomes.narrative:
"Well, if it isn't my old crew." The Silent Knife, still clad in dark leather armor, leaps down from a svelte-looking horse and comes over to greet you. "You know what? This lot gets a pass."

The Silent Knife winks at you and whispers. "Sorry for the scare. I just slum it with these guys for some entertainment between jobs."
"Huh, not ringing a bell, somehow. Now turn over your gold!"

options.label: B
options.narrative: Attack. Friend or not, those who prey on the weak should be brought to justice.

outcomes.narrative: You see the bandits form up, and you mount your strike. Some are scared off by your ferocity, but others engage you hungrily. The Silent Knife throws a few good daggers, too, before they ride off.

narrative:
"Thanks for your help with that guard." Up ahead, leaning against a tree, is your old friend the Silent Knife. They're referring to you covering for their recent hit and theft of an element potion. "It was all a big misunderstanding, really, and I could've talked my way out of it I'm sure, but I appreciate your help all the same."

The Silent Knife gives a winning smile. "So, as promised, I'm back for it. Hand it over, would you?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Give the Silent Knife the potion (requires "%data.items.gh2e-45%" %game.itemFh.45%).

outcomes.narrative: "Oh, it's beautiful. Even better than I remembered, thank you so much for keeping it safe for me. You're really the perfect crew, shame I'm retired." The Silent Knife looks up for a moment, then snaps their fingers. "Ah! I found something else I thought you'd like."

options.label: B
options.narrative: Refuse to give the Silent Knife the potion back.

outcomes.narrative:
You explain that, while you would help under other circumstances, you won't be able to return the potion to them.

"Sure, right. I see how it is. I thought I was pretty clear that I was going to come back 'round for it, and that I was just giving it to you for safekeeping. But that's fine, I'll be more careful about where I place my trust in the future."

narrative:
Before you is an impossible sight: a giant mechanical man leaning against the mountainside. Were it not seated, it would be taller than the surrounding trees. Rust and moss have built up along its jaw and chest, and you'd assume it last moved hundreds of years ago. Suddenly, the mouth creaks open.

"Halt! Stop right there, or I will defeat you!" The iron machine's mouth swings open and shut, the unfortunate sound of metal grinding against metal punctuating each word. "Such is the decree of the Automatic King!" It would be quite the feat for this creature to rise, even if it were unfettered by the forest undergrowth holding it down. You hesitantly approach.

"Halt! Kneel and swear to be my knight!" Suddenly, the chest cavity swings open, and from the darkness, a poorly-aimed arrow fires out. You think you catch a glimpse of some small figures giggling inside before it swings back shut.

"Kneel and accept the rule of the Automatic King!"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Play along and pledge fealty to the Automatic King.

outcomes.narrative:
You kneel, and the Automatic King's jaw lilts open with a bit of a giggle. "Do you pledge to serve the Automatic King and carry out his... uh, decrees?" You nod, and the Automatic King is pleased. "Then rise, my knights!"

There's a pause, then the jaw of the Automatic King creaks open again. "Also, turn around and close your eyes, because I want to give you something to show you're my knights." You do so. "And don't peek!" You hear some scrambling behind you, and a moment later, the Automatic King speaks again. "Open your eyes, and receive thy knightly armor!"

"Do good stuff in my name. Okay, bye!"

options.label: B
options.narrative: Refuse and search the ruined automaton for valuables.

outcomes.narrative: You refuse to play along with this nonsense distraction, and anyone who launches an arrow at you needs to feel the consequences. As soon as you get close enough, a group of Vermling children scurry out of all manner of places, rushing up the hillside and back towards whatever home they come from. With the automaton cleared out, it's a simple matter to investigate the ruined machine, and after prying open some panels, you discover scrap you can salvage.

narrative:
Taking shelter from the rain, you set up camp beneath the boughs of a sleepy willowburn tree. It's an idyllic spot, and even the slow drip of water off the treetops has a calming effect.

When the rain finally subsides, you spot something exposed by the runoff: the edge of a crystal protruding from the soil. You carefully dig it out to find what looks like discarded crystalline growths of at least two different Orchids, although you don't see any nearby belongings.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Bury the crystals back under the soil.

outcomes.narrative: You recognize the crystals as the product of an Orchid inosculation ceremony, where two Orchids who have pledged their lives in union remove the entirety of their crystal growths and combine them with their partner's, planting the result. If left undisturbed, this once-in-a-lifetime ritual may produce offspring. You put the earth back on top of them and move on, pleased to have witnessed it.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Dig up the crystals and take them with you.

outcomes.narrative: You dig up the crystals and stash them in your pack—they may be evidence of a crime, or at the very least, worth something to someone. Partway to your destination, though, you smell the unmistakable retch of mold—the crystals have taken on water and are dripping a foul-smelling liquid. You discard them by the side of the road and vow to buy a new bag when you return to the city.

narrative:
You hear the distinctive sound of metal-on-metal in the distance and race up a hill beside the road to investigate.

In full, antagonistic glory, you see a familiar Inox in heated battle with a group of Gloomhaven guards. Though outnumbered and bloodied, you've never seen that stop the Berserker before. The guards get a deep blow against your former companion and the Berserker flies into a rage, cleaving off limbs with the ease of cutting grass.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Assist the Berserker against the guards.

outcomes.narrative: In their blood rage, your old party member can't determine who is friend or foe. You take as many blows in the chaos as the guards, but the guards eventually fall. You call out, but the Berserker wastes no time disappearing into the nearby forest. One of the guards looks to still be alive, albeit missing a hand.

effects: To finish the job, read %game.section:18.1%.
To let the guard live, read %game.section:90.2%.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Assist the guards against the Berserker.

outcomes.narrative:
It was a brutal and bloody fight, but with your help, the guards subdue the Berserker. After the blood rage wears off, your old friend collapses from exhaustion.

The guard thanks you. "That was brutal! This Inox just went into an all-out rage—but I think we've learned a lesson today about insulting someone's horns. Right?" The guard looks over to a member of his squad, now newly missing an arm and trying to bandage the remains.

"Right, sir. Yes." The guardsman clasps the unconscious Berserker in irons and starts dragging your old friend back towards Gloomhaven. Seems they missed collecting one of the Berserker's axes, and after prying it out of the femur it was lodged in, you think it could still see some use.

narrative:
An ostentatious wagon passes you on the worn road, pulled by six gleaming-white horses. You hear a confused voice inside followed by the scrambling of reins as the wagon comes to a rapid halt. Out pops a familiar face: it's the Berserker!

"Friends! It is you! Please, come aboard, I'll happily take you wherever you're going." You climb aboard, and the bumpy, dusty road all but vanishes amidst the plush seats.

The Berserker sees your surprise. "I came into some money after a fight. Who knew fighting could make you good money? I guess it's about fighting the right people." You lean back and relax thanks to your friend's good fortune, half-dozing on the way.

You wake up an hour later with a bit of a start, as the pleasant trip is interrupted by a sticky sensation under your boot-heel. You look under the seat and see a bloody axe embedded in a merchant's corpse... likely the former owner of this very wagon.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Continue the ride without comment.

outcomes.narrative: Conversation becomes awkward, and you ask to be let out at the side of the road. The Berserker gives you a big grin. "Want to walk the rest, huh? Well, see you soon!" You nod politely.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Raise the issue with the Berserker.

outcomes.narrative:
You pull out the axe and show it to the Berserker. "I thought of all people... He insulted me, to my face! There are consequences, y'know?" The Berserker's volume is increasing, suggesting there is going to be a full-on rage soon.

You agree that without repercussions, civility can't exist. The Berserker nods along, assured there's finally someone who understands. You're dropped off just beside your destination and your murderous companion departs with a cheerful wave. "Keep the axe! I can afford a nicer one now!"You agree that without repercussions, civility can't exist. The Berserker nods along, assured there's finally someone who understands. You're dropped off just beside your destination and your murderous companion departs with a cheerful wave. "Keep the axe! I can afford a nicer one now!"

The pressure builds: "It was easier when we traveled together—no one questioned the lives we took. Suddenly, I'm at fault? Get out!" You hastily exit the wagon, and the axe is tossed out the window a moment later. It's an exhausting hike the rest of the way.

narrative:
The silence along the road gives you an itchy sense of foreboding. You know someone is watching you, but your attempts to spot from where are fruitless. Finally, you give up and call out to the surrounding trees. To your surprise, they answer.

"You are the ones who fought beside the bow-wielding Orchid, is this true?" A Vermling steps out of the undergrowth, eyeing you cautiously. "A group of wild-looking Orchids approached us in our woods. They requested rights to trade with us. To purchase our knowledge." The Vermling leans on a gnarled staff and scratches at a long, scabbed-over gash running from his ear to his neckline.

"We are always wary of traps and betrayal out here on the edge of the wilds. We have seen your actions, watched your successes. If you think these Orchids can be trusted, then we will open trade with them. If you do not, we will hunt them for their deception."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Vouch for the Orchids.

outcomes.narrative: "Trade is good for all parties, and the success reaches far. We will consider your recommendation strongly."

options.label: B
options.narrative: Advise against trading with the Orchids.

outcomes.narrative:
The Vermling nods. "Then our fears are true. These Orchids are not to be trusted. We will see to it their delegates pay the price when we next meet." The Vermling unfolds a crude drawing of something you haven't seen before.

"For you, for your honesty. Our technology may be unfamiliar to you, but it has its purpose."

narrative:
You feel a searing heat at the back of your neck, and a sense of foreboding overwhelms your consciousness. You crouch and survey the area, but there's no threat to be seen. Still, you can't shake the feeling of camouflaged hidden danger.

"Halt!" The voice rings out amongst the trees, coming from everywhere and nowhere at once. "You have trespassed on the land of the forest Orchids. Return from whence you came, or perish!" A rain of arrows peppers the ground around you to emphasize the point. "There are no exceptions. The next arrow will be a kill shot!"

You need to take cover from this murderous stalker, but when you try to stand, the crushing feeling down your spine deepens.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ask for safe passage.

outcomes.narrative:
You shout out to the voice in the trees, asking for safe passage. "Cease your speech. We will confer." There is a moment's peace, and after a few minutes, you feel the heat at the base of your neck subside. Out steps your old friend the Doomstalker.

"Friends! It is you! My charge believed you enemies, but that could not be further from the truth. Thus, she will atone by being your guide." The Doomstalker pushes a young Orchid girl forward. She is holding a solid bow and looks sheepish as she greets you.

"Sorry for assuming the worst. I'll take you through our lands." You thank your old friend, and press on.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Press forward.

outcomes.narrative: With forward momentum, you make it to the tree line, but your adversary presses the attack. They give chase and the hunt begins, with arrow after arrow slowing your progress. Eventually, you cross a stream and the pursuit stops: you must have finally left their territory. You'll find a different path next time.

options.label: C
options.narrative: Retreat.

outcomes.narrative: You throw your hands up and step slowly back out the way you came. It takes longer than you'd like, but eventually the heat at the base of your neck subsides.

narrative:
"Terrible. Wretched, sloppy. This is what mercenaries look like today? Feh! I can't believe my old trainee the Elementalist spent time with you."

An old Savvas parked by the side of the road reviews your party with disgust. "Yes, I know exactly who you are. My trainee said you were rough around the edges, but this? Back in my day, you'd never see such miserable presentation. Where're your uniforms? People pay to hire you like this? I could take you all on with an arm tied behind my back!" It shakes its head.

"How about this? I was able to whip that Elementalist into shape long before they joined you, and I can probably do something with the sorry state you're in. I'll give you a few hours of my time, you give me some coin for my trouble."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Pay the old Savvas for training (requires 5xC collective gold).

outcomes.narrative: The Savvas demonstrates techniques, tips, and methods you'd only pick up after making those mistakes yourself. You finish the training session exhausted but pleased.
effects: Lose 5xC collective gold

options.label: B
options.narrative: This insulting Savvas needs to be put in its place. Challenge it to a fight.

outcomes.narrative: You mop the floor with this indignant Savvas, leaving part of its jaw cracked open. It laughs. "Maybe the Elementalist really was a good judge of character... not bad."
The old Savvas wipes the floor with you, and you wince whenever you think of it for some time.

options.label: C
options.narrative: Since it thinks it's so great, take it up on its offer to fight you with one arm tied behind its back.

outcomes.narrative: You handily mop the floor with this indignant Savvas, leaving part of its jaw cracked open. "Heh, maybe you're a two-hander after all. Not bad, I see what the Elementalist saw in you."
The old Savvas wipes the floor with you, and you wince whenever you think of it for some time.

narrative:
A rustling outside your tent in the early morning pushes you to a groggy state of alert. Emerging from the tent, you find merely a lost kivak, the traditional steed of the Savvas peoples. These stout, horned beasts of burden have been domesticated over time, and are typically found only with someone keeping them in tow. Perhaps this one is lost?

You survey the creature as it munches a sprig of grass in the moonlight. It takes a few steps, and you can see it favoring its back left heel. Closer investigation reveals a deep cut clear to its anklebone. Thankfully, the kivak doesn't look too concerned by it.

Against the struggling of a very large, very stubborn beast, you manage to bandage the injury. Satisfied it's contributed enough, the kivak curls up and shuts its eyes, dozing in the warmth of the morning sun.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Try to find its owner.

outcomes.narrative: It doesn't take long to find the shepherd—the hundreds of kivak following behind him was a dead giveaway. "Ho there! Is that Grump? Grump, what are you doing way out here?" You explain, and the shepherd gives you his thanks. "We wander out around these parts, far and wide. If it'd be useful to you, you can take one of them along for your trip. Not Grump, obviously, he'll need some time to heal up. But they're good for carrying you and your companions."

options.label: B
options.narrative: A kivak can be useful—bring it along with you.

outcomes.narrative: You bandage the kivak's leg and it dutifully follows you towards your destination, stopping periodically to graze on wildflowers. Keeping track of it is exhausting, but perhaps this beast can help you.

narrative:
"Travelers! Ho there! If it isn't the fine folks that brought my kivak back to me." You smell the herd before you see them: a thick curtain of farm-beast odor settles across your face, coating your tongue as you approach. You greet the shepherd and try your best to suppress the taste.

"Would you care to take one of these beauties along with you? They like seeing the world, and if they get too spooked, they know to just run home to me. Fancy a friend? You're family now, so you'll get family pricing."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Rent a kivak.

outcomes.narrative: "There you are, this is the finest kivak in the herd that also happened to be the closest one when you asked for one. It'll carry you along. No need to bring 'im back, they always find their way eventually."
effects: At the start of the next scenario, designate an empty hex that can be reached by performing %game.action.move% 3 from a starting hex. Characters may choose to start in that hex or an empty hex adjacent to it instead of a starting hex.

outcomes.narrative: "Sorry, can't just let them run off for free, got a lot of mouths to feed." You watch the herd of kivak eating everything nearby, from grass to rocks. "They're not picky, but I sure am."

options.label: B
options.narrative: You're not interested in a rental today, but you'd like to say hello to the kivak named Grump.

outcomes.narrative:
The shepherd gives a loud three-note whistle, and up wanders Grump, the kivak you rescued. "Grump's been talking a lot about you, probably. I wouldn't know, I don't speak kivak. Sometimes feel like I could though, eh?"

Grump takes the opportunity to nuzzle into your hand, then wanders back to its herd.

narrative:
An explosive crack shakes you out of your tent, sending you scrambling for your weapons in the moonlight. When the adrenaline wears down, you spot a fissure at waist height carved into the air itself. Pouring out is a steady stream of water that pools on the ground below it. The disregard of physics tells you it's a rip between planes.

You pull tentatively at the edges and it opens further. Out splashes a unique jellyfish—the kind you remember your old friend the Soultether using. While you don't speak jellyfish, it looks as confused as you are.

That's when you spot it: clutched between the jellyfish's tentacles is a torn patch of the Soultether's garments. This is no random occurrence... it's a distress signal.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Abandon your current mission to come to the Soultether's aid right now.

outcomes.narrative: You quickly pack up your camp and push your belongings through the rift, following close behind. You don't know what awaits you on the other side, but if the Soultether needs help, you're there.
effects: New Scenario: A Watery Rescue 94. This scenario must be played immediately.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Note the location of the rift and return in the future.

outcomes.narrative: You mark the location of the rift down and promise to return when you're ready. The jellyfish thrashes a bit and dries up dead by the time the sun peeks above the mountainside.

narrative:
The sun has just finished painting the sky brilliant orange hues, fading to the dusk of twilight. The stars do little to illuminate your path, and you're just about to settle down for the evening when a familiar voice rings out from the darkness.

"The thread of spaces between spaces. Stars embroidered in the dark. A tapestry unwound." It is your old friend the Nightshroud, although they sound less coherent than you remember.

They shift their weight, and a hole in the air beside them follows where they stood. The Nightshroud touches the edges with curiosity, as though seeing it all for the first time. Their eyes snap into focus, looking at you with intensity.

"Step through and I will take you. We will journey together again. You won't mind the cost, your mind."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Step through the rift.

outcomes.narrative:
You step through the ragged tear in reality. Your insides stretch to vibrant jelly, your bones looping in on themselves. It is not altogether unpleasant, and you can't help but remember fish exist and that shoes can fit on hands even though they aren't intended to. What a strange notion, that we care so much about where clothes are worn even though death is watching and you can see language painted in books.

With a silence that nearly ruptures your eardrums, you arrive at your destination. You look around, calm, but the Nightshroud is nowhere to be seen. It seems like it was a success—ah, there's the splitting, stomach-churning headache you'd expect.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Thank the Nightshroud, but decide to walk to your destination instead.

outcomes.narrative:
"A spool of string can roll forever, until it snaps." The Nightshroud nods, as though it understands something important. "You have so many faces, but I will remember."

A cloud passes, casting the valley into darkness. You look closely, but the Nightshroud is gone.

narrative:
You smell the corpses before you see them. A group of five bodies spread across the road, flies buzzing around them in a frenzy.

As you get closer, you see the wretched, deformed looks on their faces and the boils covering their skin. They've been here for some time, and their patchwork of equipment suggests their former occupation: likely a group of cutthroats.

From their positions, you deduce they were engaged in battle when they suddenly succumbed to some horrible disease.

You can think of at least one way that could have happened: fine handiwork from the Plagueherald.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Leave the corpses alone.

outcomes.narrative: Knowing better than to get too close to the machinations of the Plagueherald, you keep a wide berth between you and the corpses and continue down the road.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Inspect the corpses for valuables.

outcomes.narrative: You rifle through the corpses, grabbing stray coins and valuables as you go. The sight is sickening, and while you don't feel physically ill, you do feel a certain dark pall in the air.
You make off with a good haul, but start feeling sick as soon as you're done.

options.label: C
options.narrative: Burn the bodies.

outcomes.narrative:
You gather tinder and approach the corpses as close as good sense will allow. They alight as though fueled by some unseen gas, inflating and spluttering as they burn. The ash is oppressive in the air and fills your lungs with a stinging sensation, but you take some comfort in knowing you stopped the spread to other local fauna.

If you already have IMMUNITY, add event C-90 to the city deck.

narrative:
"Well, if it isn't those resilient mercenaries that tested so much of my equipment!" By the side of the road is your old traveling companion, the Quartermaster. They've set up a sturdy stand displaying all manner of quality adventuring equipment and seem to be earning a healthy living catering to a very niche demographic.

"Who better to sell to mercenaries than a former mercenary? I'd rather sell to them than do the work myself. This is where the real money is. Every fresh-faced upstart will need an iron helmet or leather armor someday."

You take a look through the wares.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ask if the Quartermaster has any spare supplies, for old times' sake.

outcomes.narrative: "For you, anything!" The Quartermaster is happy to give you some supplies for your next battle.
effects: At the end of the first round of the next scenario, each character may %game.card.recover% one %game.card.lost% item.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Purchase something from the Quartermaster's shop.

outcomes.narrative: "I purchase everything wholesale, and I'm happy to extend those discounts on to you."
effects: Each character may immediately purchase one item from the available item supply as though its cost was five gold less and your reputation with each faction was two greater.

narrative:
A Quatryl in a foppish hat is standing in the road, seemingly waiting for you. He sweeps his leg back into a low, formal bow as you approach. With a snap, he returns to full height to address you.

"Congratulations, you have earned my esteemed accompaniment. I, Basseloff, the greatest bard in the world, am in express need of adventure to top off the tanks of mirth that fuel my passionate ballads." You are dreading how this conversation ends.

"As you are held in some regard, albeit lesser to mine own, I have selected you as fitting companions for this task. I will support your quest through the incomparable power of my verse. Be not alarmed, I have already deemed it appropriate to waive my customary 100 gold fee for the privilege of my esteemed support, so this adventure will be exclusively without cost to you." He doesn't seem to notice the emotional cost of keeping this blathering Quatryl alive.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Accept Basseloff's "help".

outcomes.narrative: "Wonderous! My melodies should give you the confidence you require!" From the very first pluck of the lute, you can tell you'll regret this.
effects: Each character adds two %game.attackmodifier.minus1% cards to their attack modifier deck for the next scenario.
Read %game.section:35.5%.
Lose 1 reputation with any one faction of your choice.

options.label: B
options.narrative: You don't want to babysit—refuse the Quatryl's assistance.

outcomes.narrative: You convince Basseloff that tagging along with you would be a terrible bore. "You're right, I require a more valiant mission to best recharge my depleted muse. Good day!"

You try to explain why it's a bad idea to come on this mission, but Basseloff is having none of it. "Hogwash! In any case, you are sure to die without my assistance. I won't hear another word of it."

He falls in line beside you, a determined grit underneath his perfectly-pressed blouse.

Read Outcome A.

narrative: Before you, nearly dead-center in the road, is a very conspicuously placed bear trap. You can see the contours of the metal jaws, and the trigger mechanism is barely covered by a single, broad leaf. It's no surprise an animal hasn't been caught yet, and it would take an absolute fool to step onto it.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Walk around the trap.

outcomes.narrative: Without much difficulty, you step around the trap and continue on your way.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Step on the trap. (Choose one character to spring it.)

outcomes.narrative: With the least surprising snap of all time, the jaws clamp down, piercing your leg. It takes some doing, but you manage to pry it off and continue on your way.
effects: The character who stepped on the trap starts the next scenario with %game.condition.immobilize% and %game.condition.wound%.

narrative:
A buzzing insect swoops around you, then flies off. A few minutes later, you find your old companion the Bladeswarm in the middle of the road. For a creature as timeless as it is, it wastes no time in greeting.

"We have 'retired' many times before, and always new threats draw us from our slumber." They pause dramatically, but when it's clear you don't have a response, they continue. "The many peoples will fight over the dirt they call home, but there is a larger threat, buried beneath the dirt. Beneath the bones, beneath the sands, beneath all creation. It waits."

It sees you're not comprehending. "No matter. You must survive the tasks today that you may fight the battles tomorrow. Tell me, should I assist you defensively or offensively?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ask for a defensive gift.

outcomes.narrative: The Bladeswarm doesn't acknowledge your request, but as you begin to leave, a vanguard of insects advance in front of you. "Do not die, you will be needed.".
effects: At the start of the next scenario, choose one revealed monster to gain %game.condition.immobilize%.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ask for an offensive gift.

outcomes.narrative: The Bladeswarm waves an arm and a stream of insects falls to the ground, scuttling to follow you. "We will assist. May you mount an overwhelming offensive."
effects: At the start of the next scenario, choose one revealed monster to gain %game.condition.wound% and %game.condition.poison%.

narrative:
A lone hristek stands beside the road, basking in the bright sun. It's carrying several packs of supplies, but there's no rider to be seen. It takes a moment for your eyes to adjust, and then you realize the truth all at once: there are thousands of bugs taking respite in the shade of the hristek, crawling across each other like a black puddle.

As soon as you take notice, it begins to draw itself up into a Harrower—and it's not until it dons a familiar helm that you realize it's your old companion, the Bladeswarm!

"Greetings. This creature is assisting in transport of my belongings. The breed is strong—they have sturdy backs and are full of blood inside their skin." The Bladeswarm falls silent, stroking the hristek. After a moment, it snaps its attention back to you and abruptly continues. "I am in search of liquid. If you can provide, I can compensate."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Sell the Bladeswarm potions.

outcomes.narrative: The Bladeswarm makes a conscious effort to nod. "I will purchase all you can produce."
effects: You may sell any number of potions for 20 gold each.

options.label: B
options.narrative: You need your equipment for your mission and have nothing to spare.

outcomes.narrative: "Then I will depart." You watch as the Bladeswarm discards its cloak and dissolves back into thousands of crawling legs and mandibles. Rather than mounting the hristek, though, it swells underneath its hooves, lifting it and conveying the confused animal down the road like a mobile black carpet. Perhaps it still has more to learn about modern society.
